entry.def: Pop is modern music that usually has a strong rhythm and uses electronic equipment.

example.ex: ...the perfect combination of Caribbean rhythms, European pop, and American soul...
example.tran: 加勒比海韵律、欧洲流行音乐和美国灵乐的完美结合

example.ex: Which great British pop band had a hit with 'In the Army Now'?
example.tran: 英国哪一支伟大的流行乐队以一曲《正在服役》风靡一时？

entry.def: You can refer to fizzy drinks such as lemonade as pop .

example.ex: He still visits the village shop for buns and fizzy pop.
example.tran: 他仍然去村里的小店买小圆面包和汽水。

entry.def: Pop is used to represent a short sharp sound, for example the sound made by bursting a balloon or by pulling a cork out of a bottle.

example.ex: Each corn kernel will make a loud pop when cooked...
example.tran: 每粒玉米在烹制时都会发出很响的啪的一声。

example.ex: His back tyre just went pop on a motorway.
example.tran: 他的后胎在高速公路上砰的一声爆了。

entry.def: If something pops, it makes a short sharp sound.

example.ex: He untwisted the wire off the champagne bottle, and the cork popped and shot to the ceiling.
example.tran: 他拧掉香槟瓶上的铁丝封口，瓶塞砰的一声直冲天花板。

entry.tran: （眼睛因惊讶、激动等而）瞪出，鼓出
entry.def: If your eyes pop, you look very surprised or excited when you see something.

example.ex: My eyes popped at the sight of the rich variety of food on show.
example.tran: 看到展示的花样繁多的食品，我的眼睛都瞪圆了。

entry.def: If you pop something somewhere, you put it there quickly.

example.ex: Marianne got a couple of mugs from the dresser and popped a teabag into each of them...
example.tran: 玛丽安娜从碗橱拿了几个杯子，在每个杯中迅速地放入茶包。

example.ex: He plucked a purple grape from the bunch and popped it in his mouth.
example.tran: 他从葡萄串上摘下一颗紫葡萄，往嘴里一塞。

entry.def: If you pop somewhere, you go there for a short time.

example.ex: He does pop down to the pub, but he seldom stays longer than an hour...
example.tran: 他确实会去酒馆小坐一下，但停留时间很少超过一小时。

example.ex: Wendy popped in for a quick bite to eat on Monday night.
example.tran: 温迪周一晚上过来匆匆吃了点儿饭。

entry.def: Some people call their father pop .

example.ex: I looked at Pop and he had big tears in his eyes...
example.tran: 我看着爸爸，他眼睛里泪光盈盈。

example.ex: Yes, Pop, I made a big mistake — you and Mark made me realize that.
example.tran: 是的，爸爸，我犯了一个大错误，你和马克让我意识到了这一点。

means.word_mean: 1. an informal term for a father; probably derived from baby talk
2. a sweet drink containing carbonated water and flavoring;

sentences.sentence: "in New England they call sodas tonics"

means.word_mean: 3. a sharp explosive sound as from a gunshot or drawing a cork
4. music of general appeal to teenagers; a bland watered-down version of rock'n'roll with more rhythm and harmony and an emphasis on romantic love

sentences.sentence: "His eyes popped"
"He popped out to shortstop"
"The cork of the champagne bottle popped"

means.word_mean: 4. fire a weapon with a loud explosive noise;

sentences.sentence: "The soldiers were popping"

means.word_mean: 5. cause to make a sharp explosive sound;

sentences.sentence: "He popped the champagne bottle"
"The farm popped into view as we turned the corner"
"He suddenly popped up out of nowhere"

means.word_mean: 7. put or thrust suddenly and forcefully;

sentences.sentence: "pop the pizza into the microwave oven"
"He popped the petit-four into his mouth"
"pop the clutch"
"He popped me on the head"
"He downed three martinis before dinner"
"She killed a bottle of brandy that night"
"They popped a few beer after work"
"The man charged with murder popped a valium to calm his nerves"

means.word_mean: 12. cause to burst with a lound, explosive sound;

sentences.sentence: "The child popped the balloon"

means.word_mean: 13. burst open with a sharp, explosive sound;

sentences.sentence: "The balloon popped"
"This popcorn pops quickly in the microwave oven"

means.word_mean: 1. (of music or art) new and of general appeal (especially among young people)
1. like a pop or with a pop;

sentences.sentence: "everything went pop"

sentences.en: The balloon will pop if you put a pin in it.
sentences.cn: 如果扎进一颗大头钉, 气球就会突然爆开。

sentences.en: He could pop off any day now.
sentences.cn: 他哪一天都有可能突然死去。

sentences.en: An idea popped into his mind like a flash.
sentences.cn: 他头脑里突然闪过一个念头。

means.word_mean: 使破裂, 发出短促清脆的声音

sentences.en: He popped the balloon with a pin.
The policemen popped him on the jaw and knocked him cold.
sentences.cn: 警察狠狠地打他的下腭，打掉了他的气焰。

sentences.en: The boy popped his head round the door.
sentences.cn: 这小男孩在门口探了探头。

sentences.en: We popped a question at her.
sentences.cn: 我们出其不意地问了她一个问题。

means.word_mean: (把准备好的东西)突然拿出来

sentences.en: He popped a letter out of his briefcase.
sentences.cn: 他从公文包里突然掏出一封信。

means.word_mean: 把项目(从后续的目录里)取出来

sentences.en: When this operation is over,the computer pops the next goal from the goal stack.
sentences.cn: 这项作业结束之后，计算机就从任务书里把下次任务提取出来。

sentences.en: We heard the pop of a cork.
sentences.cn: 我们听见瓶塞砰的一声打开。

sentences.en: The pop music added to our enjoyment of the film.
sentences.cn: 片中的流行音乐使我们对这部电影更加喜爱。

jushi.english: He could pop off any day now.
jushi.chinese: 他哪一天都有可能突然死去。

jushi.english: She keeps popping in and out.
The balloon will pop if you put a pin in it.
